events.message: The policyholder reported a vehicle collision that occurred on the morning of April 29th, involving their car and another sedan at a busy intersection.
After initial review, the claim was categorised under Auto Accident due to the descriptions of the collision and the damages reported to the vehicle.
A claims agent was promptly assigned to handle the case and establish communication with the policyholder to guide them through the next steps.
The insurance company officially acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the policyholder that the necessary procedures would begin immediately.
The claims team requested detailed documents including the police report, photographs of vehicle damage, and a copy of the driver's license for verification.
The policyholder submitted all requested documents, including the official police report and multiple photos showing clear damage to the vehicle.
The investigation team began a thorough review of the claim details and the submitted evidence to assess liability and damage extent.
Investigation findings concluded the policyholder was not at fault; the other driver was responsible for the accident at the intersection.
The insurer proposed a settlement amount that covered all estimated repairs and additional rental car expenses during the vehicle's repair period.
The policyholder expressed satisfaction with the clear communication and prompt settlement offer, acknowledging the insurer’s support through the process.
The insurance claim was formally approved by the claims manager after all validations and customer feedback were reviewed.
Settlement funds were issued to the policyholder’s designated bank account to cover the car repairs and rental fees.
The claim file was officially closed following final payment and confirmation that the repair work was completed satisfactorily.
All claim documents and correspondence have been archived in compliance with company policy for future reference if needed.
